lines.content: Sonic is a task management Command Line Interface application that helps the user organize tasks, whether it's a to-do task, a deadline, or an event.
1. Ensure you have Java 17 or above installed on your computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for your TaskList.
4. Open a command terminal, cd into the folder you put the jar file in and run the following:
Adds a new todo task to the task list.
Got it, I have added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Adds a new deadline to the task list.
Got it, I have added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Adds a new event to the task list.
Got it, I have added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Displays all the tasks in the task list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmarks the task as not completed.
Ok, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Deletes the task from the task list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Finds all tasks containing the keyword entered.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
The user can use these date and time formats for deadline and event features:
Sonic stores tasks in a file named sonic.txt at ip/data/sonic.txt.
The tasks are saved in the sonic.txt in the below format:
`E | 0 | do the user guide | 6pm | not sure`
When the user launches Sonic, it automatically loads the tasks from sonic.txt into the task list.
Any changes made to the task list are instantly saved, ensuring the tasks remain accessible even after restarting the application.
* Initializes the user interface (UI), storage, and task list.
* It is the main class for the Sonic task management program.
* It runs the main logic for interacting with the user and processing commands.
* Initializes the Sonic application with the specified file path.
* It sets up the UI, storage, and attempts to load tasks from the storage file.
* If an error occurs while loading the tasks, an error message is shown and an empty task list is created.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Runs the main loop of the Sonic application.
* It repeatedly displays the welcome message, reads user input,
* and processes commands until the user exits the program.
* It provides methods for formatting dates, times, and datetime inputs.
* Formats a date string into a more readable format (e.g., "MMM dd yyyy").
* If the input cannot be parsed, it returns the original string.
* @param dateString The date string to be formatted (e.g., "2025-03-05").
* @throws DateTimeParseException If the input date string is not in the expected format.
* @return The formatted date string (e.g., "Mar 05 2025") or the original string if invalid.
* Formats a time string into a more user-friendly format (e.g., "hh:mm am/pm").
* If the input is invalid, it returns the original string.
* @param timeString The time string to be formatted (e.g., "1530").
* @throws NumberFormatException If the input time string cannot be parsed.
* @return The formatted time string (e.g., "3:30 pm") or the original string if invalid.
* Splits a datetime string into date and time parts.
* @return A string array which divides the user input into parts, or null if invalid.
* Determines the correct format for the given date and time components.
* @param part1 First component of the split datetime string.
* @param part2 Second component of the split datetime string.
private static String determineFormat(String part1, String part2) {
* Formats a datetime string into a more user-friendly format.
* @param dateTimeString The datetime string to be formatted (e.g., "2025-03-05 1530").
* @return The formatted datetime string (e.g., "Mar 05 2025 3:30 pm") or the original string if invalid.
* Parses user input, validates commands, and delegates appropriate actions.
* Parses the user's command input and delegates appropriate actions to the task list,
* @param userInput The command input provided by the user.
* @param taskList  The TaskList instance that holds and manages the tasks.
* @param ui        The Ui instance used for displaying messages to the user.
* @param storage   The Storage instance for saving task data.
* @return Returns false if the user input is "bye", terminating the program, otherwise true.
public static boolean parseCommand(String userInput, TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Mark format error! Try the command: 'mark <task number>'");
ui.showMessage("Unmark format error! Try the command: 'unmark <task number>'");
ui.showMessage("Todo needs a description! Try the command: 'todo <task description>'");
ui.showMessage("Delete format error! Try the command: 'delete <task number>'");
ui.showMessage("Please provide a keyword for search.");
* Validates the format of the 'event' command.
* @param ui The Ui instance for displaying messages.
* @return True if the event command is valid, false otherwise.
private static boolean isValidEvent(String[] inputParts, Ui ui) {
ui.showMessage("Event format error! Try the command: 'event <event description> /from <start> /to <end>'");
* Validates the format of the 'deadline' command.
* @param ui The Ui instance for displaying messages.
* @return True if the deadline command is valid, false otherwise.
private static boolean isValidDeadline(String[] inputParts, Ui ui) {
ui.showMessage("Deadline format error! Try the command: 'deadline <description> /by <time>'");
* Handles the loading and saving of tasks to a file.
* It is responsible for reading task data from a file and saving task data to a file.
* Initializes the Storage object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Loads the tasks from the file specified by the file path.
* If the file does not exist, an empty task list is returned.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If file does not exist.
* @return An ArrayList of Task objects loaded from the file.
* Saves the provided list of tasks to the file specified by the file path.
* If there is an issue with writing to the file, an error message is printed.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* Parses a line from the file into a Task object.
* The line format is expected to be "Type | Done Status | Description | Additional Info".
* @param line The line to be parsed.
* @return A Task object created from the parsed data, or null if the line is invalid.
System.out.println("Invalid task format: Missing mandatory fields.");
System.out.println("Invalid Event format: Missing event time or place.");
* Represents a Deadline task, a type of Task with a description and a due date.
* Initializes a Deadline task with the given description and due date.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by The due date of the Deadline task (in string format).
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format is: "D | isDone (1 or 0) | description | by".
* @return A string suitable for saving the Deadline task to a file.
* Represents an Event task, a type of Task with a description, start time, and end time.
* Initializes an Event task with the description, start time, and end time.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the Event task.
* @param start The start time of the event (in string format).
* @param end The end time of the event (in string format).
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* The format is "[E][StatusIcon] description (from: start to: end)".
* @return A string representation of the Event task.
* Returns a string representation of the Event task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format is: "E | isDone (1 or 0) | description | start | end".
* @return A string suitable for saving the Event task to a file.
* Represents a task with a description and a status indicating whether it is done or not.
* It provides methods to get the status, description, and to serialize the task for saving.
* Initializes a Task with a given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns a status icon representing whether the task is done or not.
* The icon is "X" if the task is done, and " " if it is not done.
* @return The status icon of the task ("X" or " ").
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status and description.
* @return A string representation of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format is: "TaskType | isDone (1 or 0) | description".
* @return A string suitable for saving the task to a file.
* Represents a Todo task, a type of Task with a description.
* Initializes a Todo task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the Todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task.
* @return A string representation of the Todo task.
* Returns a string representation of the Todo task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* The format is: "T | isDone (1 or 0) | description".
* @return A string suitable for saving the Todo task to a file.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to interact with the list.
* Tasks can be marked as done, added, deleted, or searched.
* Prints all tasks in the list to the user.
* @param ui The Ui instance for displaying messages
ui.showMessage("No tasks in your list right now, you are free!");
ui.showMessage("Here are the tasks in your list:");
